intro: Ludwigia cylindrica var. brachycarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces tiny, yellowish flowers that are typically borne in dense inflorescences. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in shallow water or moist soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in aquatic gardens and pond settings.
